Adult male.description: Varied Thrushes of the Pacific Coast have an orange eyebrow, a black breastband, and orange wingbars that American Robins do not have.

Female/immature.description: Female/immature Varied Thrushes have an orange eyebrow and wingbars unlike American Robins that do not have eyebrow marks or wingbars.

Adult male.description: Spotted Towhees are smaller with a stouter bill than American Robins. They have a black hood that extends down to their breast with the rusty color restricted to their sides, unlike American Robins which have a reddish breast and a complete reddish belly.

Eastern Towhees are smaller with a stouter bill than American Robins. They have a black hood that extends down to their breast with the rusty color restricted to their sides, unlike American Robins which have a reddish breast and a complete reddish belly.
